moves.1... d5 2. d4 Nf6: Transposes to the Queen pawn's game.
moves.3. c3 Bf5 4. Nbd2 e6 5. Ne5: I don't see much point behind this move.
moves.12. Nd4 Bg6: Retaining the bishop since it might have some prospects on the b1-h7 diagonal and it stops White's LSB from going to d3.
moves.25... Rc7 26. Be6+ Kf8 27. c4 dxc4 28. b: ? I can't believe I made this move!
moves.31... Ne4: ! The best chance. Black threatens a fork on g3.
moves.32. Bxe7+: ? White returns the favor.It is best off delaying the capture.I think the best move is 32.Rg1.Although after 32...f2 33.Rxg5 Nxg5 34.Bxe7+ Kxe7 35.Kg2 Ne4 Black can draw with best play.
moves.32... Kxe7: Now White can't parry the threats of 33...Ng3+ and 33...Kxe6.
moves.33. Bg4 Ng3+ 34. Kg1 Nxf1 35. Kxf1 Bxg4: Now Black is ahead two pawns and winning the game again.
moves.42... h5 43. Rd4 Rc5 44. Rd7 g4+ 45. Kg3: Usually trades help the defender,but not in this situation.
moves.46... Ra3 47. Rf7+ Kg6 48. Re7 Kf6 49. R: White trades pawns hoping he can take the passer.
moves.51... Rxe3 52. Rxa6+ Kf5 53. Ra5+ Kf4 54: Blocking the checks from the king.
moves.55. Ra5 g3: A blunder that throws away the win.fortunately my opponent doesn't see it.
moves.56. Rxh5: ?? A blunder that loses immediately.56.Rg5! draws!
moves.56... Re2: Black must lose his rook or be mated.
